Title: Flickering Monitor
Summary:
If your monitor is flickering, follow these steps:

Turn off the power to your monitor. The button is usually on the front at the bottom right.
Ensure that the cord from your computer to your monitor has a tight connection both at your computer and at the monitor.
Turn the power to your monitor back on.

If this does not resolve your issue then please log a case.

Title: PTO Accrual Policy
Summary:
All full-time employees are eligible for Paid Time Off (PTO).

PTO benefits do not accrue during the first three months of employment. Beginning in the employee's fourth month of employment the employee will earn 1.25 days of PTO for each full month of employment.

After the completion of an employee's fourth year of employment, the accrual rate will increase to 1.667 days of PTO for each full month of employment.

Title: Requesting a Privacy Screen for Your Monitor
Summary: Privacy screens reduce eye fatigue from excess glare, and also hamper people looking at your monitor while you are working. You can order a privacy screen using the contact information below.

Title: Requesting a Second Monitor for Your PC
Summary: Depending on the model of your PC or docking station, you may be able to connect an additional monitor. Log a case and specify the model of your PC or docking station.

Title: What Is The Difference Between PTO and Sick Time?
Summary: Paid time off is a bank of hours from which employees can draw. Your PTO balance covers vacation time as well as sick days. Under this program, it does not matter to the company whether your PTO is for vacation or sick time, and the accruals allow for both. Please note, however, that since PTO is intended to cover sick time, employees should remain home when sick rather than coming into the office and risk infecting others. Employees who come to work sick will be asked to leave and stay home while they recover.

Title: Office furniture for remote workers
Summary:
We have a policy for allowing remote workers to purchase office furniture from the same supplier we use to furnish our offices, at the same discount we get as a company. In some cases, your manager may approve reimbursement for these purchases, but that is at manager discretion.

  • Review the remote office equipment policy
  • Review the remote office equipment catalog
  • Open a purchasing ticket for items that are provided by the company
  • Request manager approval before purchasing equipment that you expect to be reimbursed for

Title: Lost and Damaged Phone Replacement
Summary:
Lost devices are a security hazard, so please make sure to open a case as quick as possible using the chat option. If you don't have access to Concierge features at all, because you have no phone and aren't near a computer, please call 555-555-5555.
Damaged phones can be replaced with similar devices, unless you are within 6 months of the normal upgrade cycle. If you work from one of our offices, stop by any IT Station for a swap.
For remote employees, we will overnight you a new device and provide an envelope for returning your broken device, which can either be repaired or recycled by the vendor. To initiate this process, start a live chat
